alert.note: Alert for Central Marion; Eastern Marion; Western Marion (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 3:55PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Marion County through 500 PM EDT... At 354 PM EDT, Doppler radar showed a band of thunderstorms with heavy rain developing across northern and central Marion County. This band is expected to move slowly southward at 5-10 mph, and bring a few inches of rain that could lead to minor flooding. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Ocala, Salt Springs, Juniper Springs, Lynne, Weirsdale, Sparr, Anthony, The Village of Briar Meadow, Ocklawaha and Moss Bluff. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Marion; Eastern Marion; Western Marion
